intro: Kermadecia leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf kermadecia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in coastal or rocky habitats, often in areas with well-drained soils. Kermadecia leptophylla is a relatively rare species, found primarily on the Kermadec Islands and some parts of the North Island.
